StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdatePackage]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @PackageId uniqueiden..er, @UserName varchar(100), @Lock bit = 0, @Archive bit = 0 ) AS
DECLARE @Result int
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM [ACP].[Package] WHERE [PackageId] = @PackageId) BEGIN IF EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM [ACP].[Package] WHERE [PackageId] = @PackageId AND [Locked] = 1 AND [LockedBy] = @UserName) BEGIN UPDATE [ACP].[Package] SET [Locked] = @Lock, [LockedBy] = CASE @Lock WHEN 1 THEN @UserName ELSE NULL END, [DateLocked] = CASE @Lock WHEN 1 THEN GetDate() ELSE NULL END, [UploadedBy] = @UserName, [DateUploaded] = GetDate(), [Archived] = @Archive WHERE [PackageId] = @PackageId
-- Record the update in the PackageAc.on table. INSERT INTO [ACP].[PackageAc.on] ([PackageAc.onId],[PackageId], [Ac.onType], [Ac.onDate], [UserName]) VALUES (NewId(), @PackageId, 'UPLOADED', GetDate(), @UserName)
--Package was Updated. SET @Result = 4
END ELSE BEGIN IF EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM [ACP].[Package] WHERE [PackageId] = @PackageId AND [Locked] = 0 AND [LockedBy] IS NULL) SET @Result = 0 --Package was not locked. ELSE SET @Result = 1 --Package was locked by someone else. END END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [ACP].[Package] ( [PackageId], [Locked], [LockedBy], [DateLocked], [Archived], [UploadedBy], [DateUploaded] ) VALUES ( @PackageId, @Lock, CASE @Lock WHEN 1 THEN @UserName ELSE NULL END, Case @Lock WHEN 1 THEN GetDate() ELSE NULL END, 0, @UserName, GetDate() )
-- Record the crea.on in the PackageAc.on table. INSERT INTO [ACP].[PackageAc.on] ([PackageAc.onId],[PackageId], [Ac.onType], [Ac.onDate], [UserName]) VALUES (NewId(), @PackageId, 'CREATED', GetDate(), @UserName)
--Package was Created. SET @Result = 2 END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully, commit the transac.on COMMIT TRANSACTION
SELECT @Result
